channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IA

item.title: Report X-2024040421
item.description:
Report X-2024040421

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: CEDAR RAPIDS
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came down on the NC belt and leaked on the belt and the floor. Package handler and QA member cleaned Hazmat liquid with absorbent pads in house clear up was successful hazmat was then put in a red lined tote and brought to QA station to do proper hazmat disposal process. DescribePack: broken/loose cap on both bottles. one completely broke off and other bottle just lost its cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: In house clean up. used absorbent pads to clean up spill

item.title: Report X-2024040468
item.description:
Report X-2024040468

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-29
  • City: OTTUMWA
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler was unloading a trailer and spotted a damp package. Package was put into a tote and sent to QA for inspection. During inspection, it was determined the the battery was leaking battery acid. DescribePack: The package seemed to be in good condition with sufficient packing material. This has lead station personnel to believe the battery was compromised before it was picked up. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: the package was put into a tote and the battery was set upright to reduce the leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024040109
item.description:
Report X-2024040109

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SPILLED IN TRANSIT FREIGHT NOT BLOCK AND BRACED, BOX WAS SMASHED BETWEEN FREIGHT. TRAILER WAS PARKED IN REAR OF YARD AND BEGAN TO LEAK OUT THE BACK OF THE TRAILER. THE SERVICE CENTER HAS PLACED SOMETHING TO KEEP FROM LEAKING OUT OF TRAILER ONTO GROUND.

item.title: Report X-2024040129
item.description:
Report X-2024040129

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-11T15:11:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-01
  • City: DES MOINES
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PULLER NOTICED LIQUID COMING FROM THE PACKAGE A RESPONDER WAS CALLED. UPON INSPECTION IT WAS NOTED THAT ONE BOTTLE HAD A LOOSE CAP. THE CAP WAS TIGHTENED THE AREA CLEANED UP. PACKAGE WAS MOVED TO THE HAZMAT TRAILER PROCESSED.
